Description: Two joining fragments of oval, tapering, handle from neck join to sharpish turn of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine pink-buff; cream slip. Rectangular stamp.
Production date: 170 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 142.)
Curator's comments: Ink, deleted, '271'. Name Athanodotos. Probably from the same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABC 0040.26.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (94)
